page.title: 09New look for old houses.
page.content: When less labour was needed on farms,some families moved into town and their homes became delapidated and beyond the scope of local wages to buy or repair.Now many people from towns are buying and renovating the old houses.Often two terraced houses become one well planned family home.Some areas of farmland near villages have been used for small new developments.Infilling has made village streets look more complete particularly in Kington Magna.The old village school has become two unusual homes while the large rectory is now owned by a large dairy concern producing milk,cream and yoghurt under the name Old Rectory Farm. The name of a nearby new bungalow,Godwins Orchard shows its site origin.
